intro: Dissochaeta bibracteata, commonly known as the two-bract dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Dissochaeta bibracteata is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, open habitats.
